net.sf.javaml.featureselection

Interface FeatureScoring

  • All Superinterfaces:
    FeatureSelection
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GainRatio, KullbackLeiblerDivergence, RandomForestAttributeEvaluation, RELIEF, SymmetricalUncertainty, WekaAttributeSelection

    public interface FeatureScoring
extends FeatureSelection
    Interface for all attribute evaluation methods. Attribute evaluation methods can be used to calculate the worth of a certain attribute. This is interesting for removing attributes with little information to make your algorithms run faster.
    Version:
    %SVN.VERSION%
    Author:
    Thomas Abeel (thomas@abeel.be)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double score(int attribute)
      Evaluate a single attribute.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.sf.javaml.featureselection.FeatureSelection

        build, noAttributes

    • Method Detail

      • score

        double score(int attribute)
        Evaluate a single attribute. This should return a value between 0 and 1. The higher the value, the better the feature is.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the index of the attribute to evaluate
        Returns:
        the worth of that attribute, a value between 0 and 1.
